attendees: Sarah Black (Ofqual), David Thompson (APUK CEO), Margaret Foster (APUK Head of Quality)
summary: Annual compliance review and Statement of Compliance preparation meeting
notes: Discussed Statement of Compliance requirements for 2026. APUK confirmed readiness to submit by deadline. Reviewed progress on addressing previous compliance concerns. Noted ongoing work on IT infrastructure improvements and quality assurance framework enhancements. Action: APUK to provide updated risk register by end of November.

attendees: Jane Lee (Ofqual), David Thompson (APUK), Sarah Mitchell (APUK IT Director)
summary: Follow-up on security risk assessment findings
notes: Reviewed progress on security protocol updates following identification of potential vulnerabilities. APUK provided evidence of immediate patching actions and comprehensive security audit planning. Discussed timeline for infrastructure modernization. Further monitoring required. Next review scheduled for mid-January 2026.

attendees: Mike Brown (Ofqual), Margaret Foster (APUK), James Wilson (APUK Operations Manager)
notes: APUK presented progress on new QA framework rollout across all assessment centres. Discussed training completion rates (78% to date) and implementation challenges. Reviewed sample centre audit reports showing improvements in standardization. Action items agreed for remaining centre onboarding in Q1 2026.

attendees: Alex Green (Ofqual), David Thompson (APUK), Margaret Foster (APUK)
summary: Pre-submission Statement of Compliance final review
notes: Final review of APUK Statement of Compliance submission. Clarified remaining documentation requirements and evidence formatting. APUK provided responses to outstanding queries from November meeting. Confirmed submission deadline of January 31, 2026. Overall positive assessment of compliance trajectory.

attendees: Lisa White (Ofqual), Amanda Rogers (QTL), Peter Collins (QTL)
summary: Centre monitoring and remote assessment discussion
notes: QTL presented enhanced monitoring procedures for remote assessment locations. Discussed implementation timeline and resource requirements. Reviewed investment in monitoring technology. Positive progress noted in addressing compliance gaps.
BAAS confirmed successful patch deployment for results processing system. Testing completed with no issues identified. Enhanced monitoring procedures in place. Risk formally closed.

attendees: Rachel Brown (Ofqual), Marcus Anderson (CEX), Sophie Turner (CEX)
notes: CEX demonstrated new AI-enhanced detection tools in development. Discussed pilot program results and scalability challenges. Reviewed partnership with technology providers to counter emerging AI-assisted cheating methods. Follow-up meeting scheduled for February 2026.
